Description: Handle sherd of Chian Animal Chalice, Grand or Simple Animal Style pottery chalice; white slip; interior: glazed black with traces of two bands in added white; exterior: black (fired reddish) on handle with part of handle frill around root; below, part of single band.
Excavator/field collector: Excavated by: Dr David George Hogarth
Curator's comments: Object owned and held by Akademisches Kunstmuseum. This record is included in the British Museum database as part of the Museum’s Naukratis Project, a research collaboration that aims to virtually re-unite finds from the ancient port city of Naukratis, now distributed over 80 museums worldwide.

Lemos places the sherd within the Mature Animal Style, but the tongue pattern around the handle, whilst occuring occasionally on Mature Animal Style chalices, is a common feature on Mature Animal and Grand Style chalices as well.
Bibliographic references: Lemos 1991 / Archaic Pottery of Chios. The Decorated Styles (p. 303, no. 1129, pl. 155)
Piekarski 2001 / Die Keramik aus Naukratis im Akademischen Kunstmuseum Bonn (p. 22, no. A9, pl. 3, 1)
Himmelmann & Geominy 1992 / Rheinisch-Westfälische Akademie der Wissenschaften (p. 24, fig. 4c, p. 52-3)
Villing et al 2013-2015 / Naukratis: Greeks in Egypt (GD.0699) (phase 2)
